intro: Serruria stellata, commonly known as the star-flowered serruria, is a striking South African plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its showy, star-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink, often with a contrasting central stripe. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is found in the Western and Eastern Cape provinces. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Serruria stellata is a popular choice for rock gardens due to its ornamental value and adaptability to dry conditions.
